intro: Vvedenskyella, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Vvedenskyella has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, herbaceous stems. It plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitats by providing nectar for pollinators.
